place.settlement: wäräda Kǝlǝttä ʾAwlaʿlo, ṭabiya Mahbärä Wäyni, qušät Gwaḥtärat

note.ab: Gädam. Currently, there are no monks, the monastic community declined after 1970s. The church compound is adjacent to the area of the traditional school, with the huts of the students (up to 20).

15 Mss. photographed: GSQ-001 “Four Gospels”; GSQ-002 “1. Orit zä-lelawǝyan 2. Orit zä-fǝträt( fols. 7-18) 3. Tǝmhǝrtä didǝsqǝlya (fols. 19-36) 4. Proverts (fols. 37-40) 5. Orit zä-däʿat (fols. 51-53) 6. Mäṣḥafä Henok (fols. 51-79) 7. MäṣḥafäṬobit (fols. 80-85) 8. Mäṣḥafä ʾṮsayǝyyas (fols.86-94) 9. ʿƎrgätä ʾṮsayǝyyas (94-95) 10. Tägśaš zä-solomon (100-101) 11. Mäṣḥafä ʿƎzra (103vc-108)”; GSQ-003 “Psalter”; GSQ-004 “Miracles of Qirqos. Image of Qirqos.”; GSQ-005 “1. story of the Fathers 2. Mar Yǝshaq 3. Paradise of montes”; GSQ-006 “Faith of the Fatheres ”; SQ-007 “Vita of Kiros”; GSQ-008 “2. Antiphonary for feusts and funeral service”; GSQ-009 “Horologium for the Night and the Morning Hours”; GSQ-010 “Missal”; GSQ-011 “Miracles of Mary”; GSQ-012 “Book of the Funeral Rite”; GSQ-013 “Vita of Täklä Haymanot; Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”; GSQ-014 “Synaxarion (The second half of the year)”; GSQ-015 “Dǝggwa; Ṣomä dǝggwa“.
Tabots of 2 of Mary, 2 of Qirqos, one unidentified marble.
